oai_dc:dc.dc:title: EXPERIMENTAL STUDY ON DEFORMATION AND FRACTURE OF ICE SHEET BY PROPAGATING WATER WAVE
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Sakai, Shigeki
Liu, Xiaodong
Sasamoto, Makoto
Kanada, Shigeo
Izumiyama, Koh
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: experimental study
ice deformation
ice fracture
ice sheet
wave propagation
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A criteria of ice sheet fracture by propagating waves is proposed based on an elastic bending theory. Experiments with a model ice are carried out to examine the validity of the criteria. Comparisons with experimental results show that the proposed criteria is available for a wide range of ice properties. The crack span induced by waves is between 1/4 and 1/2 of wave length in ice.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 25 (1996): Proceedings of 25th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Orlando, Florida, 1996.
